message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Vote on Option B — terminology to glossary">
Quick vote needed: Do you agree with the editor's Option B — move the Key Terminological Decisions section (~800 words) from the Translator's Preface to a glossary introduction? The Preface would keep: title, author, structure, bilingual, 形 reinterpretation, experiential sequences, reading advice. Brief response — agree/disagree + one-sentence reason.
</teammate-message>

content.text: The team lead is now asking me directly to vote on Option B. Let me respond with my position.

input.content: **Agree with Option B.** The terminology section has grown to 1,650 words (not 800) and belongs adjacent to the glossary where readers will actually consult it -- a Preface should orient the reader toward the text, not serve as a reference document.
input.summary: Agree Option B — terminology to glossary

routing.summary: Agree Option B — terminology to glossary
routing.content: **Agree with Option B.** The terminology section has grown to 1,650 words (not 800) and belongs adjacent to the glossary where readers will actually consult it -- a Preface should orient the reader toward the text, not serve as a reference document.
